nodes.bodyText: The Javadoc has been copied from FlatLayout
How those changes are related to the Pull Request?
@Sammers21 it's just a minor cosmetic change in related class
@g4s8, move this change to a separated Pull Request with minor changes since this change has no intersections with this Pull Request goals.
Org layout and User based are different terms. I'd suggest sticking with only one, so the Javadoc would be consistent with the actual code

+ * This object resolves repository HTTP endpoints for specified URL. + * Artipie supports two primary layout configurations: + *

    + *
  • Flat layout - Artipie doesn't use any structural layout, all repositories + * are located at the root of base path, e.g. URI {@code https://central.artipie.com/maven} + * accesses {@code maven} repository.
    • + *
  • User based - Artipie installation has multiple namespaces/organizations/users,

nodes.bodyText: Is this change somehow related to the Pull Request?

 public interface Settings {

nodes.bodyText: Except for one field REPO_PREF, how OrgLayout is different from FlatLayout? I could not find any differences.
I think it is a code duplication which should be fixed.
@Sammers21 OrgLayout reads two first part of URI to find repository config and to specify storage prefix, FlatLayout uses only first. But it can be refactored later.
@g4s8, where is the puzzle for that?
@g4s8 I think, this pattern is too restricted: how about dashes ('-'), underscores ('_') and some other symbols? Valid path symbols can be looked here
@g4s8 We need to validate this when instantiate adapters from config or to make restriction weaker. Examples in our README.md violate this constraint (npm-proxy, my-php)
@brastak done, fixed
@g4s8 We need test for new param and documentation (please, add todos)

The only difference between this pattern and the one at FlatLayout.REPO_PREF is the minimum amount of / symbols and parts in between them, 2 in case of FlatLayout and 3 in this case. This also could be decomposed. An example:
Pattern REPO_PREF = new PathLevel(3)

@Sammers21 Pattern is a final class and can't be extended. Also, we may consider changing the format of first or second part here, so it'll require more changes than using pattern string. I'd keep it as is while the format is not established as a requirement.

@g4s8, how about this?:
Pattern REPO_PREF = Pattern.compile(new PathLevel(3))
(?:[a-zA-Z0-9_]+) repeated 3 times, decompose it somehow so you would not do the same changes 3 times like you did it in 448782a
@Sammers21 see #187 (comment) we can do it later when the format of these parts will be stable
